personal_information_definition: First name or initial + last name combined with: SSN (full or last four digits with additional identifier), driver's license number or state ID number, financial account number or credit/debit card number (with access code), passport number, military ID number
Username or email address combined with password or security question and answer to an online account
Health information or health insurance information as defined by HIPAA
breach_definition: Unauthorized access and acquisition of unencrypted and unredacted computerized data that compromises the security or confidentiality of personal information maintained by an individual or entity as part of a database of personal information regarding multiple individuals, and that causes or is reasonably believed to cause identity theft or other fraud.
encryption_safe_harbor_details: No notification required if data was encrypted or redacted, unless the individual or entity reasonably believes that the encryption key or security credential was also accessed or acquired.
notification_timeline: Without unreasonable delay, no later than 60 days from discovery
notification_content_requirements: Description of the incident in general terms
Type of personal information subject to unauthorized access and acquisition
General acts taken to protect the personal information from further unauthorized access
Telephone number to call for further information and assistance
Advice to the individual to monitor their accounts and credit history for suspicious activity
Contact information for the AG's office
penalties: AG enforcement. Civil penalties up to $150,000 per breach, or up to $150,000 for violations involving failure to notify. Injunctive relief available. No private right of action under the breach notification statute.
special_provisions: Must notify AG regardless of number affected (no threshold for AG notification)
Virginia Consumer Data Protection Act (VCDPA, effective 2023) adds comprehensive data privacy requirements
